Reviews.Title: “I wont go back NEVER!”
Reviews.Author: Tomplayita
Reviews.Content: They never took the time to say "hi", never took the time to show me a menu at the bar, they didnt allow me to smoke even if the bartender was smoking 1m away from our table. No smile, no pleasure...worst place ever...and im living in playa for 1year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central place with nice bar”
Reviews.Author: l0vingh0lidays
Reviews.Content: the rooms are clean and ok and "rana cansada" is just around the corner from 5th avenue and just a few minutes walk from the caribbean beach

Reviews.Title: “A great home-base for people looking to save on a hotel, and splurge on the things to do”
Reviews.Author: lissy_123
Reviews.Content: If you’re looking to stay at a 5 star resort in Playa del Carmen, find a different place to stay now. La Rana Cansada is not your typical tourist trap; rather it is a welcoming establishment, with an air of staying with your laid-back relatives. Owners Thed & Pia go out of their way to ensure you have a pleasant stay. Upon arriving, my husband and I were a little distraught – our bus from the airport had been in an accident, leaving us to find our own route from the accident to the hotel. Thed immediately took care of us, brought us complimentary beers and upgraded our reservation to the suite with 2 balconies and a small kitchen. (The stove was a traditional Mexican stove – not something that we would have used because we didn’t know how, but the fridge and microwave were nice to have!!) Throughout our week-long stay, Thed and his friend (also staying at the hotel) offered countless suggestions for places to eat, things to do, and a means of doing it all for cheaper! Thed even called his favorite restaurant, Tango Taco, to make sure they would stay open for us and ordered for us over the phone – we were exhausted and it was appreciated! Thed would check in at the end of the day as we’d come back from our adventures to make sure that everything was up to standard. They also have a reading corner where travelers are welcome to borrow books – this definitely was appreciated by day 3 for me! Some things to note: - We did have 3 cockroach encounters (sadly, 2 were within our first 20 minutes when we were already a little fragile from travelling and our accident… not a fun way to start!). That said, you’re in Mexico… what do you expect? - Other reviews mention the noise – they aren’t kidding. We listened to terrible conflicting Mexican techno all night every. We were warned that the music would go late (until 2:00am) and were somewhat prepared for that. But in reality it never died. The music actually went all the way to 7:00am, had a 15 minute break, and then the morning mix started. By the end of the week, we were exhausted. We had briefly considered taking a “if you can’t beat them, join them” approach, but couldn’t because of the excursions we had booked and the early start times for those days. A simple solution: bring earplugs. - Past reviewers complained about the hardness of beds. I've stayed in Mexico 3 times in the past year and found that each time the beds were about the same. I don't think that's a fair complaint for La Rana Cansada! - The property is on a major strip, 10 Calle and between 5th & 10th, but is not right on the beach. There are lots of places on the beach where you can rent a lawn chair and park for the day. We found Alhambra to be the best price (about $8.50 for the two of us for the whole day) and we could order our drinks as we wanted them. The other places cost more ($15 a day) and we felt obligated to always have a drink on the go so it added up to a lot more! A few general recommendations for your trip to Playa del Carmen: - Eat at La Parrilla (on 5th heading towards Jaurez) and get the Tacos Arraqueso or Manuel’s special. Or Tango Taco (on 10th Calle heading West towards Walmart) and get the Arracherra Steak or one of the Milaneses. These 2 restaurants were definitely our most favorite and among the cheapest! - Make sure to book excursions to Chichen Itza and Xel-Ha. They are incredible! Tulum was nice too, but way too crowded. If I could do it again, I would have just paid a cab to take me to Tulum early in the day and paid the entrance fee so I could avoid the massive crowds. All in all, I would do this trip again, but I think the earplugs would have drastically improved my experience! I would consider them a necessity for a return trip to La Rana Cansada.

Reviews.Title: “¡Me gusta La Rana!”
Reviews.Author: PlayaLili
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited Playa del Carmen several times over the last ten years, and it’s been fascinating to watch its transformation from quaint fishing town and backpackers’ haven to vibrant travel destination attracting diverse international visitors. We’ve just returned from our most recent visit. Once again we stayed at La Rana Cansada because we enjoyed it so much on our previous trip. The hotel’s owners, Pia and Thed, are warm, gracious hosts, and their staff is consistently friendly and helpful. We love the festive vibe at Bar La Ranita and have come to feel almost like honorary members of its community of expats and locals. Already scheming for the next get-away to our “home away from home” … that food fest thing coming up in November sounds pretty compelling. ☺ Lili & Greg PS As a previous reviewer has noted, manager Jorge DOES make a stellar marg!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service at the bar - stay away from the female bartender”
Reviews.Author: 2TravellingCanucks
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the hotel, but went to the bar for drinks. The male bartenders were fine - we were sitting right up at the bar - but a quarter of the evening through they switched and there was a female bartender who was only interested in hanging out with her friends and getting free drinks from the customers. We were not impressed, especially considering we have bar owners in the family, and know exactly what good service is supposed to be. My husband, who never gets upset, could not believe how horrible this woman was - she didn't even look at us once all night. Sadly, based on this, we will never be back to this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, friendly staff, near everything”
Reviews.Author: Piroz_H Posted by an Apollo traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, friendly and very helpfull staff, a mix of international and mexian crowd, young, trendy.

Reviews.Title: “La Rana Cansada Always my choice!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jshawnhh
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Playa del Carmen many times in the past and a few years ago I finally found La Rana Cansada. I've stayed nowhere else since! La Rana is a quaint and charming hotel with Mexican style rooms and Mexican charm. A lovely garden area with tropical plants is central of the rooms,. There is a choice between air conditioning or not, and the rates are not expensive. It is very close to the beach(just a little over a block). The owners are amazing people who do their best to make each and every guest feel at home. The Bar Ranita is attached to the hotel, and is a hub of activity with many expats and locals alike, gathering in the evenings for drinks and conversation. I was at La Rana on their Anniversary, and I had expected a big party. There was an AMAZING party with free tacos which were amazing. The party went into the night and Everyone was so happy. This is Mexico, a land of enjoying and celebrating life. La Rana is a unique and awesome place, that is not for everyone, but those who "get it" return over and over and over again. Don't hesitate to give La Rana a try. I would also like to respond to the previous post... and I can show proof to anyone who wants it of how many times I have stayed at La Rana, and of my most recent week-long stay. The owners were host to several hundred guests the night of the Anniversary party, and could not possibly have been expected to give anyone undivided attention. I was there throughout the party and your accusations of "assault" border on slander. Please look at the bulk of reviews of La Rana... I love the place and would recommend it to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Mexico”
Reviews.Author: SylviaQt
Reviews.Content: When I travel to other cities, I want to experience the destination as much as possible. La Rana Cansada provides the feel of Mexico in your room! Mexican tile floors, cement walls, bright colors for the curtains and bedsheets. A little on the rustic side, but good. The courtyard is open with a beautiful canpoy of Bougainvillea. The bar is amazing, with friendly staff and no shortage of locals. Steps from the nightlife, shopping and restaurants in Playa, this hotel has a great location. The rooms can be warm in the summer, and the mattress is thin. If you don't mind those things, this is the hotel for you! We ended up being upgraded to one of the suites. Our balcony had a bucket that you dropped down with your drink order. The bartender would make your beverages, ring a bell - instant room service. How cool is that?

Reviews.Title: “Great for solo travelers”
Reviews.Author: miss_bach
Reviews.Content: Since I am often traveling solo and always afraid to get stuck in a place where it is only couples or very family oriented I am always looking for a place where it is easy to meet people. And La Rana Cansada makes it impossible not to. It may not be the best hotel when it comes to comfort (but still very nice rooms) but a friendlier atmosphere you have to look for. This is the place where people go to even if they don't stay at the hotel. It is also the place where you meet people who actually lives in Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Rana Cansada cheap compared to others”
Reviews.Author: janve
Reviews.Content: You are there because it's one of the cheaper hotels in playa del carmen. Playa start to be more expensive like Cancun and I'm happy when i arrive in a more cheap Merida where you have more value for your money .... The rooms are basic (no tv, just a bed, a shower a fan and a chair.) and the atmosphere is good. There is a nice bar closeby but no noise from there. One big disadvantage is the noise doors. They are double doors. One is the "normal" and the other is the mosquito door. Everytime somebody go in or out this one slams and makes a lot of noise. In the morning when you want to continue sleeping and people are leaving, this can be a problem. When we were there they were cleaning all the time and the rooms looked clean. I would recommend this hotel to a friend if he's young (under 45) or need to take care of his budget.

Reviews.Title: “Una Rana muy Cansada”
Reviews.Author: Simon2099
Reviews.Content: I had just return from La Rana Cansada, it looked nice after reading the comments in here, but it was something different when I arrived. Here are some material facts instead of those “Friendly smiling people” type, frequently used. About the property... 1.No architecture, it is a small yard surrounded by rooms, dark and hot with bad ventilation. 2.There is no division between the bar and rooms but the yard, you can hear the voices when you are sleeping as you were in the bar. About the rooms... 1.Dark with poor ventilation. The bathrooms have not a single window, they become into a sauna every time you need to close the door. 2.Small with bad distribution, there is no place to put a medium size bag on the floor. The hammock is in the middle of the room, making near to impossible to cross over the place. 3.The beds are as you can see in their pictures, hard as rocks. 4.The room with no A/C is as hot as a convection oven, there is no air circulation even keeping the door opened. One small window with no curtains near to the ceiling allows the Sun to come over your bed in the morning directly to your face. 5.The door of the next room was always opened blocking ours since when the door of one room is opened the other must be closed. Even pushing such door it always returned. 6.There was always a big black dog at the entrance of the room blocking the way to walk around. 7.There are not smokers / non smokers spaces, all the smog gets concentrated. 8.No security boxes, TV, phone nor Internet in rooms. About the maintenance... 1.No hot water in the shower. 2.The toilet does not work properly. About the management. 1.It was a problem to make the reservation with Jez (The manager) by e-mail, it must be done by phone. 2.I asked about how hot were the rooms and Jez said they were fine. 2.The check in was bad recorded, when the check out was made (18hrs, after I arrived) there was as if I stayed for one week. 3.When reserving, the rate includes taxes to be paid with credit card, but there you have to pay 12% extra of taxes for invoicing and 6% for credit card. There are a lot of hotels as cheap as La Rana Cansada with better facilities, location and friendly staff, frequently more professional. Please review some pictures in Internet before to make the same mistake than I, it does not matter what other people say, what you see in there is what you will get as my review describes. You may think you have to deal with bad service when you are paying a low rate, but this is not the case in Playa del Carmen since it is not any more a small fishermen village located in the middle of the jungle.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sonnydog
Reviews.Content: I love to travel to Playa. Off the beach hotels provide less expense, therefore more trips to Playa. I recently stayed at La Rana Cansada and what a pleasant surprise. From the manager Jorge, Thed one of the owner's and especially the great bar staff, this is a part of the Playa experience that makes the stay fun! Friendly courteous people who even let you know when the band will be playing in case you are concerned about noise. I definitely will stay at this hotel again, the price is right, the staff is great and you leave feeling good. Mark from Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Very cute and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Drerae
Reviews.Content: Jez was so helpful and friendly. My friend and I came with an open iteniary and Jez was so helpful on suggestions for day trips as well as great places to eat. The room was so cute with the thached roof. It was exactly what i needed, a place to rest and shower. I went to Walmart and bought food to cook, it was nice to have access to a kichenett. Loved the bar downstaires was full of locals and expats as well as people staying in the hotel. It was central to everything, and had everything I could ask for. I would recomend this hotel to all my friends and family. It was no frills but very comfortable. I could not ask for anything more but to wake up and open the door to blooming hybiscus flowers in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “nicest place to stay”
Reviews.Author: alge
Reviews.Content: as another reviewer said-- it aint the Ritz, but frankly i have stayed at the Ritz and this place beats it hands down for service and smiles. The Rana is a simple hotel-- a courtyard surrounded by room on the ground level and some rooms upstairs. I stayed there this xmas and new years. The staff were all great. Jez, who manages the place for owners Pia and Ted was helpful, always around when you needed him and had great recommendations for food etc. The attached bar was an excellent place (recently enlarged) it is the home of an international gang of locals who run many of the best activities in the area so you can drink a beer whilst booking a dive or an ATV adventure. what you need to know-- there are no tvs, no phones in the rooms, no business centres and no internet access (though they may have wireless). Now if that is what you are looking for go to one of the big impersonal hotels. They do have AC (some reviewers may have been there before it was in), a lovely outside kitchen where you can cook if you want to, and hammocks inside the rooms and outside (you get beds too!), 24 hours someone is looking after things so if you get locked out (whoops, yes i did) someone wll let you in Ted and Pia have been there many years and are great to chat to. Their friend runs Babes across the road which is a great Thai restaurant and other friends run the best coffee bars etc in town. They threw a great party for xmas and another crazy one for new years and we were welcome at both. Trying to think of any gripes but i can't think of much. Compared to much of mexico, playa is pricey and Rana reflects this. You are not on the beach like many hotels but you are only a minute away. Oh-- yes, i have a gripe. The bar staff make the worst Margaritas in the whole of Mexico. Except Jorge. But their beers are cold and they were a great laugh.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Fxhero
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rana Cansada towards the end of our honeymoon. We thought the place was great! The rooms were all different and very cosy, take a look around before deciding. The downstairs bar was a lot of fun with lots of drinks (try the limonada!) and interesting patrons. The location was great, we walked to the beach (100m) and had drinks by the beach. It is right next to 5th Av so you can stroll there for breakfast in the moring or or shopping during the evening. We had a great time staying at Rana Cansada and will definitely stay there next time we come to Playa. Cheers, Runar & Ullie

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went there on our honeymoon and loved it. Look - this isn't "The Ritz" and you aren't going to have high speed internet in your room. Instead, we did have A/C, but did not have a phone, alarm clock or TV (nor did we want any of these). However, that was made clear to us when we made the reservation. If you're looking for anything more, be sure to ask. As for location, it would be hard to find a better location anywhere in Playa. We will ALWAYS stay at Rana Cansada when we travel to Playa in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: travlinmanUtah
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have stayed at La Rana Cansada a number of times and found a warm welcome every time. I travel often in Southern Mexico and once owned a home in Playa Del Carmen. Ted and Pia own this small motel and have always gone the extra mile to make every guest feel welcome no matter where you are from, both they and many of their staff are multilingual so they can provide a good value in accommodation and also direct you to any restaurant or other attraction you may have interest in. Take it from an experienced travelerLa Rana Cansada is a great place to stay and a very good value in Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “THE UNFRIENDLY FROG”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Rana Cansada last year in February for about five nights. Although it was priced well (35USD), the room was fairly noisy and hot (had a ceiling fan but no window!). When we were shown to our first room, we immediately noticed a stong burning smell coming from the ceiling fan. We asked for another room and the owner's demeanor immediately changed from helpful to impatient, and remained unfriendly the rest of the trip. (I promise we weren't being "picky.") Has a nice courtyard with a bar and board games, but not at all a family atmosphere. Generally, the owners didn't go out of their way to make us feel welcome.

HotelInfo.Name: La Rana Cansada
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 10 #132, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
